snowbound.api

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • snowbound.api.Position
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Positionable

    public class Position
extends Object
implements Positionable
    A raw hexgrid coordinate, using axial coordinates.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Position(int x, int y)
      Creates a coordinate using the specified x and y values.

    • Method Detail

      • x

        public int x()

        public Position position()
        Specified by:
        position in interface Positionable
        Returns:
        itself (the position of a position is itself)

      • offset

        public Position offset(Direction dir)
        Returns a new position in the specified direction.

        The resulting position may not corrospond to a valid tile in the game map. To check if there is a tile at this position, and to get a reference to that tile, use the tileAt method in the Turn class.

        Returns:
        the position offset in the specified direction

      • distance

        public int distance(Position p)
        Returns the hexgrid Manhattan distance between this position and a specified position.

        The resulting distance does not take in to account whether or not a path exists between the two positions.

        Returns:
        the Manhattan distance between this position and the specified position.

      • neighbors

        public Set<Position> neighbors(int distance)
        Returns the neighbors within a certain Manhattan distance of this position.

        The resulting positions may not corrospond to a valid tile in the game map. To check if there is a tile at each of the returned positions, and to get references to those tiles, use the tileAt method in the Turn class.

        Parameters:
        distance - the neighborhood distance
        Returns:
        a set of positions which are within the specified neighborhood distance

      • neighbors

        public Set<Position> neighbors()
        Returns the neighbors within a Manhattan distance of 1.

        The resulting positions may not corrospond to a valid tile in the game map. To check if there is a tile at each of the returned positions, and to get references to those tiles, use the tileAt method in the Turn class.

        Returns:
        a set of positions which are within a Manhattan distance of 1.
